oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Work camps; Construction camps; Construction workers; Construction; Soil conservation; Construction equipment; Boxing
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939; African Americans; African Americans -- Employment; Boxing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Composite of twelve photographs showing the daily life of Civilian Conservation Corps Company 3462.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Civilian Conservation Corps in Tennessee Collection, 1933-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Company 3462 was organized at Collierville, Tennessee, in August 1935. Its members were involved in soil conservation efforts. The company was cited for efficient and courageous service during the January 1937 flood.
